item.title: Harvey Weinstein pleads not guilty to LA sexual assault charges
item.description: The disgraced Hollywood producer appears in court in a wheelchair, facing sexual assault charges.

item.title: John Lydon likens Sex Pistols agreement to slave labour
item.description: Johnny Rotten's former bandmates are suing him to allow the band's music to be used in a TV drama.

item.title: Taylor Swift: No more Grammys for singer's re-recorded Fearless album
item.description: She will not submit the new version of her 2008 album, though 2020's Evermore will be in contention.

item.title: Craig Charles to replace Shaun Keaveny on 6 Music
item.description: The actor and DJ will take over on the station's weekday afternoon show from October.

item.title: AJ Tracey, Headie One and Pa Salieu lead GRM Daily Rated awards
item.description: The three rappers have four nominations apiece, while Little Simz is up for best female artist.

item.title: Doctor Who's John Bishop in car crash avoiding 'big chicken'
item.description: John Bishop, 54, was travelling through Wales to get a ferry to Ireland at the time.

item.title: Glastonbury decides against one-off concert in September
item.description: Organisers say they've decided not to press ahead with staging the one-day festival.

item.title: Vue Cinemas apologise over Birmingham seat crush death
item.description: The chain was fined Â£750,000 after Ateeq Rafiq died after getting trapped at Star City.

item.title: Liverpool stripped of Unesco World Heritage status
item.description: The city is deleted from the much-coveted Unesco list because of developments on the waterfront.

item.title: Sutton Hoo: New pop-up theatre venue gets Olympic treatment
item.description: A theatre company is working a former member turned top designer to create the pop-up forest venue.

item.title: Latitude 2021: What being a Covid test event means for the festival
item.description: The festival in Suffolk will be the first major event following the lifting of most restrictions.

item.title: Benin Bronzes: Nigeria dispute jeopardises return of artefacts
item.description: Several museums in Europe have talked of returning the looted artefacts - but where will they be housed in Nigeria?

item.title: Lee Child: Why Forsyth's Day Of The Jackal was a game-changer for thrillers
item.description: The Jack Reacher novelist explains the huge influence of Frederick Forsyth's first thriller.

item.title: Cocaine in the UK: The DJ and friends helping addicts beat their 'beasts'
item.description: More people in the UK are taking cocaine. A DJ and ex-addict in Liverpool is helping them stop.

item.title: Stephen Fretwell: 'Gavin and Stacey song equated to a part-time job'
item.description: Stephen Fretwell on his hit TV show theme tune and why his 13-year music hiatus has come to an end.

item.title: Cannes Film Festival 2021 highlights: Sun, stars and saliva
item.description: A-listers flocked to the Cannes Film Festival's red carpet, despite the pandemic.

item.title: James Norton: Why making Nowhere Special made me sob and want children
item.description: The Grantchester actor on the emotional toll of playing a dying father and why he doesn't mind fame.

item.title: Elizabeth Gaskell: The Victorian author feeling the Bridgerton effect
item.description: Experts say the success of period dramas online has brought Elizabeth Gaskell a new audience.

item.title: The Broadway dancer whose lockdown business bloomed
item.description: When Covid closed New York theatres, dancer Robbie Fairchild started a business that put down roots.

item.title: England nightclubs reopen: Cheers and celebrations as clubbers return for first night out
item.description: For some revellers in Leeds, this was the first time they'd ever been to a nightclub.

item.title: Amy Winehouse documentary 10 years on from death shows 'more rounded image'
item.description: The late singer's father says he hopes a new documentary will show a "more rounded image" of Amy.

item.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories: Why Hollywood stars like Ryan Reynolds are lining up
item.description: Other stars to have taken part include Tom Hardy, Dolly Parton and Sir Elton John. Here's why.

item.title: Indiana Jones scenes filmed in Glasgow city centre
item.description: Filming is in full swing in Glasgow city centre for the new Indiana Jones movie.

item.title: Summer of Soul: New film revives lost Harlem Cultural Festival of 1969
item.description: A new film, the Summer of Soul, will explore the Harlem Cultural Festival and why it was forgotten.

item.title: Rashford mural artist: 'Incredible how people have come together'
item.description: Street artist Akse, who has repaired his Rashford mural, says local people have united to show their support.
